algorithms.name: convert NDEFRecord.data bytes
algorithms.html:
To <dfn id="dfn-convert-ndefrecord-data-bytes" tabindex="0" aria-haspopup="dialog" data-dfn-type="dfn">convert NDEFRecord.data bytes</dfn>
      given a <var data-type="NDEFRecord">record</var>, run these steps:

steps.html: Let bytes be the value of record's data attribute.
Let recordType be the value of record's recordType attribute.
If the recordType value is "smart-poster", then return the result of running parse records from bytes given bytes and "smart-poster".
If running validate external type on recordType returns true, then return the result of running parse records from bytes given bytes and "external".
Otherwise, throw a "NotSupportedError".

algorithms.name: obtain permission
algorithms.html: To <dfn id="dfn-obtain-permission" tabindex="0" aria-haspopup="dialog" data-dfn-type="dfn">obtain permission</dfn>, run these steps:

steps.html: Let state be the result of getting the current permission state with "nfc".
If state is "granted" (i.e. permission has been granted to the origin and global object using the Permissions API), return true.
Otherwise, if state is "prompt", then optionally request permission to use "nfc" from the user. If that is granted, return true.
Return false.

algorithms.html: The page visibility change steps for this specification, given the string visibilityState and the Document document, are:

steps.html: If visibilityState is "visible", resume NFC and abort these steps.
Otherwise, perform these steps:
Suspend NFC.
Attempt to abort a pending write operation.
Attempt to abort a pending make read-only operation.

algorithms.name: abort a pending write operation
algorithms.html:
To attempt to <dfn id="dfn-abort-a-pending-write-operation" tabindex="0" aria-haspopup="dialog" data-dfn-type="dfn">abort a pending write operation</dfn>,
    run the following steps:

steps.html: If there is no pending write tuple tuple, abort these steps.

If <var>tuple</var>'s writer has already initiated an ongoing NFC data transfer,
        abort these steps.
Reject tuple's promise with an "AbortError" and abort these steps.

algorithms.name: abort a pending make read-only operation
algorithms.html:
To attempt to <dfn id="dfn-abort-a-pending-make-read-only-operation" tabindex="0" aria-haspopup="dialog" data-dfn-type="dfn">abort a pending make read-only operation</dfn>,
    run the following steps:

steps.html: If there is no pending makeReadOnly tuple tuple, abort these steps.

If <var>tuple</var>'s writer has already made an NFC tag permanently read-only,
        abort these steps.
Reject tuple's promise with an "AbortError" and abort these steps.

algorithms.name: release NFC
algorithms.html: To release NFC on an environment settings object, perform the following steps:

steps.html: Suspend NFC.
Attempt to abort a pending write operation.
Attempt to abort a pending make read-only operation.
Clear the activated reader objects.
Release the NFC resources on the underlying platform.

algorithms.name: NDEFReader/write()
algorithms.html: The NDEFReader.write method, when invoked, MUST run the write a message algorithm:

steps.html: Let p be a new Promise object.
If not currently executing in the currently active top-level browsing context, then reject p with and "InvalidStateError" and return p.
Let <var data-type="NDEFMessageSource">message</var> be the first argument.
Let <var data-type="NDEFWriteOptions">options</var> be the second argument.

Let <var data-type="AbortSignal">signal</var> be the <var data-type="NDEFWriteOptions">options</var>’ dictionary member
            of the same name if present, or null otherwise.
If signal is aborted, then reject p with signal's abort reason and return p.
If signal is not null, then add the following abort steps to signal:
Run the abort a pending write operation on the environment settings object.
React to p:
If p was settled (fulfilled or rejected), then clear the pending write tuple if it exists.
Return p and run the following steps in parallel:
If the obtain permission steps return false, then reject p with a "NotAllowedError" and abort these steps.
If there is no underlying NFC Adapter, or if a connection cannot be established, then reject p with a "NotSupportedError" and abort these steps.
If the UA is not allowed to access the underlying NFC Adapter (e.g. a user preference), then reject p with a "NotReadableError" and abort these steps.
If pushing data is not supported by the underlying NFC Adapter, then reject p with a "NotSupportedError" and abort these steps.
An implementation MAY reject p with a "NotSupportedError" and abort these steps.

Let output be the notation for the NDEF message to be created by UA, as the result of invoking create NDEF message with message, "", and 0. If this throws an exception, reject p with that exception and abort these steps.
Attempt to abort a pending write operation.
Set this.[[WriteOptions]] to options.
Set this.[[WriteMessage]] to output.
Set pending write tuple to (this, p).
Run the start the NFC write steps whenever an NFC tag device comes within communication range.

algorithms.name: start the NFC write
algorithms.html: To <dfn id="dfn-start-the-nfc-write" tabindex="0" aria-haspopup="dialog" data-dfn-type="dfn">start the NFC write</dfn>, run these steps:

steps.html: Let p be the pending write tuple's promise.
Let writer be the pending write tuple's writer.
Let options be writer.[[WriteOptions]].
If the NFC tag in proximity range does not expose NDEF technology for formatting or writing, then reject p with a "NotSupportedError" and return p.
Verify that NFC is not suspended.
In case of success, run the following steps:
If device is an NFC tag and if options's overwrite is false, read the tag to check whether there are NDEF records on the tag. If yes, then reject p with a "NotAllowedError" and return p.
Let output be writer.[[WriteMessage]].
Initiate data transfer to device using output as buffer, using the NFC adapter in communication range with device.
If the transfer fails, reject p with "NetworkError" and abort these steps.
When the transfer has completed, resolve <var data-type="Promise">p</var>.

algorithms.name: create NDEF message
algorithms.html:
To <dfn id="dfn-create-ndef-message" tabindex="0" aria-haspopup="dialog" data-dfn-type="dfn">create NDEF message</dfn> given <var data-type="NDEFMessageSource">source</var>,
      <var data-type="string">context</var>, and <var data-type="unsigned short">recordsDepth</var>,
      run these steps:

steps.html:
Switch on source's type:
DOMString
  • Let textRecord be an NDEFRecord initialized with its recordType set to "text" and data set to source.
  • Let records be the list « textRecord ».
  • Set source's records to records.
BufferSource
  • Let mimeRecord be an NDEFRecord initialized with its recordType set to "mime", data set to source, and mediaType set to "application/octet-stream".
  • Let records be the list « mimeRecord ».
  • Set source's records to records.
NDEFMessageInit
  • If source's records is empty, throw a TypeError.
  • Increment recordsDepth by one.
  • If recordsDepth > 32, throw a TypeError.
unmatched type
  • throw a TypeError.
Let output be the notation for the NDEF message to be created by the UA as a result of these steps.
For each record in the list source's records, run the following steps:

Let ndef be the result of running create NDEF record given record, context, and recordsDepth or make sure the underlying platform provides equivalent values to ndef. If the algorithm throws an exception e, reject promise with e and abort these steps.
Add <var>ndef</var> to <var>output</var>.
If running check created records given output and context throw an error, reject promise with error and abort these steps.
Return <var>output</var>.

algorithms.name: check created records
algorithms.html:
To <dfn id="dfn-check-created-records" tabindex="0" aria-haspopup="dialog" data-dfn-type="dfn">check created records</dfn> given <var data-type="NDEFRecord sequence">records</var>
        and <var data-type="string">context</var>, run these steps:

steps.html: If context is "smart-poster" and records does not contain exactly one URI record, or if it contains more than one type record, size record or action record, throw a TypeError.
If context is "smart-poster", move the URI record to the beginning of records.

algorithms.name: create NDEF record
algorithms.html:
To <dfn id="dfn-create-ndef-record" tabindex="0" aria-haspopup="dialog" data-dfn-type="dfn">create NDEF record</dfn> given <var data-type="NDEFRecordInit">record</var>,
        <var data-type="string">context</var>, and <var data-type="unsigned short">recordsDepth</var>, run these steps:

steps.html: Let ndef be the representation of an NDEF record to be created by the UA.

If record's id is not undefined:
  • Let identifier be record's id.
  • Set ndef's IL field to 1.
  • Set ndef's ID LENGTH field to the length of identifier.
  • Set ndef's ID field to identifier.

Switching on record's recordType, invoke the algorithm specified below with record, ndef, context and recordsDepth and return the result. If an exception e is thrown, reject promise with e and abort these steps.
"empty"
  • map empty record to NDEF.
"text"
  • map text to NDEF.
"url"
  • map a URL to NDEF.
"mime"
  • map binary data to NDEF.
"smart-poster"
  • map smart poster to NDEF.
"absolute-url"
  • map absolute-URL to NDEF.

If record's recordType starts with a colon U+003A (:):
  • If context is "" (i.e. record is not a payload to another NDEF record), reject promise with a TypeError and abort these steps.
  • If running the validate local type steps on record's recordType returns false, reject promise with a TypeError and abort these steps.
  • Return the result of running map local type to NDEF given record, ndef, context, and recordsDepth. If that throws an exception e, reject promise with e and abort these steps.

If running validate external type on record's recordType returns true, return map external data to NDEF given record, ndef, context, and recordsDepth. If that throws an exception e, reject promise with e and abort these steps.
Otherwise, throw a TypeError and abort these steps.

algorithms.name: split external type
algorithms.html:
To <dfn id="dfn-split-external-type" tabindex="0" aria-haspopup="dialog" data-dfn-type="dfn">split external type</dfn> given <var data-type="USVString">input</var>, run
        these steps:

steps.html: If U+003A (:) is not found in input, return failure.
Let domain be the input from the start of input up to but excluding the first occurrence of U+003A (:).
Let type be the input after the first occurrence, if any, of U+003A (:) up to the end of input.
Return the <var>domain</var> and <var>type</var> pair.

algorithms.name: validate external type
algorithms.html:
To <dfn id="dfn-validate-external-type" tabindex="0" aria-haspopup="dialog" data-dfn-type="dfn">validate external type</dfn> given <var data-type="USVString">input</var>, run
        these steps:

steps.html: Let domain and type be the result of running split external type, or return false if failure.
If domain is not a valid domain string, return false.

If type contains code points that are not ASCII alphanumeric, or U+0024 ($), U+0027 ('), U+0028 LEFT PARENTHESIS ((), U+0029 RIGHT PARENTHESIS ()), U+002A (*), U+002B (+), U+002C (,), U+002D (-), U+002E (.), U+003B (;), U+003D (=), U+0040 (@), U+005F (_), return false.
Return true.

algorithms.name: validate local type
algorithms.html:
To <dfn id="dfn-validate-local-type" tabindex="0" aria-haspopup="dialog" data-dfn-type="dfn">validate local type</dfn> given an <var data-type="USVString">input</var> run
        these steps:

steps.html: Let localTypeName be the input after the first occurrence of U+003A (:) up to the end of input.
If localTypeName is not a USVString or its length exceeds 255 bytes, return false.

If <var>localTypeName</var> does not start with a lowercase character or a
          number, return false.
If input is equal to the record type of any NDEF record defined in its containing NDEF message, return false.
Return true.

algorithms.name: map empty record to NDEF
algorithms.html:
To <dfn id="dfn-map-empty-record-to-ndef" tabindex="0" aria-haspopup="dialog" data-dfn-type="dfn">map empty record to NDEF</dfn> given <var data-type="NDEFRecordInit">record</var>,
        <var>ndef</var>, run these steps:

steps.html: If record's mediaType is not undefined, throw a TypeError.
If record's id is not undefined, throw a TypeError.
Set the ndef's TNF field to 0 (empty record).
Set the ndef's IL field to 0.
Set ndef's TYPE LENGTH field, and PAYLOAD LENGTH field to 0, and omit TYPE field and PAYLOAD field.
Return <var>ndef</var>.

algorithms.name: map text to NDEF
algorithms.html:
To <dfn id="dfn-map-text-to-ndef" tabindex="0" aria-haspopup="dialog" data-dfn-type="dfn">map text to NDEF</dfn> given <var data-type="NDEFRecordInit">record</var> and <var>ndef</var>,
        run these steps:

steps.html: If record's mediaType is not undefined, throw a TypeError.
If the type of record's data is not DOMString or BufferSource, throw a TypeError and abort these steps.
Let documentLanguage be the document element's lang attribute.
If documentLanguage is the empty string, set it to "en".
Let language be record's lang if it exists, or else to documentLanguage.
If record's encoding is neither undefined nor "utf-8", throw a TypeError and abort these steps.
Let encoding label be "utf-8".

Switch on the type of record's data:
DOMString
BufferSource
Let encoding label be record's encoding if it exists, or else "utf-8".
If encoding label is not equal to "utf-8", "utf-16", "utf-16le" or "utf-16be" throw a TypeError.
Let encoding name be the name obtained from encoding label.
Let header be a byte constructed the following way:
If encoding name is equal to UTF-8, set bit 7 to the value 0, or else set the value to 1.
Set bit 6 to the value 0 (reserved).
Let languageLength be the length of the language string.
If languageLength cannot be stored in 6 bit (languageLength > 63), throw a SyntaxError.
Set bit 5 to bit 0 to languageLength.
Let data be an empty byte sequence.
Set the first byte (position 0) of data to header.
Set position 1 (second byte) to position languageLength of data to language.
Let stream be the resulting byte stream of running UTF-8 encode on record's data.
Read bytes from stream into data (from position languageLength + 1) until read returns end-of-stream.

Switch on the type of record's data:
DOMString
BufferSource
Set bytes from record's data into data (from position languageLength + 1) .
Set length to the length of data.
Set the ndef's TNF field to 1 ( well-known type record).
Set the ndef's TYPE field to "T" (0x54).
Set the ndef's PAYLOAD LENGTH field to length.
If length > 0, set the ndef's PAYLOAD field to data.
Return <var>ndef</var>.

algorithms.name: map a URL to NDEF
algorithms.html:
To <dfn id="dfn-map-a-url-to-ndef" tabindex="0" aria-haspopup="dialog" data-dfn-type="dfn">map a URL to NDEF</dfn> given <var data-type="NDEFRecordInit">record</var> and <var>ndef</var>,
        run these steps:

steps.html: If record's mediaType is not undefined, throw a TypeError.
If record's data is not a DOMString, throw a TypeError.
Let url be the result of parsing record's data.
If url is failure, throw a SyntaxError.
Let serializedURL be serialization of url.
Match the URI prefixes as defined in NFC Forum Technical Specifications, URI Record Type Definition specification, Section 3.2.2, against the serializedURL.
Let prefixString be the matched prefix or else the empty string.
Let prefixByte be the corresponding prefix number, or else 0.
Let shortenedURL be serializedURL with prefixString removed from the start of the string.
Let data be an empty byte sequence.
Set the first byte of data to prefixByte.
Let stream be the resulting byte stream of running UTF-8 encode on shortenedURL.
Read bytes from stream into data (from position 1) until read returns end-of-stream.
Set length to the length of data.
Set the ndef's TNF field to 1 (well-known type record).
Set the ndef's TYPE field to "U" (0x55).
Set the ndef's PAYLOAD LENGTH field to length.
If length > 0, set the ndef's PAYLOAD field to data.
Return <var>ndef</var>.

algorithms.name: map binary data to NDEF
algorithms.html:
To <dfn id="dfn-map-binary-data-to-ndef" tabindex="0" aria-haspopup="dialog" data-dfn-type="dfn">map binary data to NDEF</dfn> given <var data-type="NDEFRecordInit">record</var> and
        <var>ndef</var>, run these steps:

steps.html: If the type of a record's data is not BufferSource, throw a TypeError.
Let mimeType be the MIME type returned by running parse a MIME type on record's mediaType.
If mimeType is failure, let mimeTypeRecord be a new MIME type record whose type is "application", and subtype is "octet-stream".
Set arrayBuffer to record's data.
Set <var data-type="unsigned long">length</var> to <var>arrayBuffer</var>.[[ArrayBufferByteLength]].
Set <var data-type="byte sequence">data</var> to <var>arrayBuffer</var>.[[ArrayBufferData]].
Set the ndef's TNF field to 2 (MIME type).
Set the ndef's TYPE field to the result of serialize a MIME type with mimeType as the input.
Set the ndef's PAYLOAD LENGTH field to length.
If length > 0, set the ndef's PAYLOAD field to data.
Return <var>ndef</var>.

algorithms.name: map external data to NDEF
algorithms.html:
To <dfn id="dfn-map-external-data-to-ndef" tabindex="0" aria-haspopup="dialog" data-dfn-type="dfn">map external data to NDEF</dfn> given <var data-type="NDEFRecordInit">record</var>,
        <var>ndef</var>, and <var data-type="unsigned short">recordsDepth</var>, run these steps:

steps.html: If record's mediaType is not undefined, throw a TypeError.
Let domain and type be the result of running split external type with record's recordType.
Let domain be the result of running domain to ASCII with domain and true.
Let customTypeName be domain, ":" and type concatenated.
If customTypeName is not a USVString or its length exceeds 255 bytes, throw a TypeError.
Set the ndef's TYPE field to customTypeName.
If the type of a record's data is not BufferSource or NDEFMessageInit, throw a TypeError.
Set ndef's TNF field to 4 (external type record).
If the type of a record's data is BufferSource,
Set arrayBuffer to record's data.
Set <var data-type="unsigned long">length</var> to <var>arrayBuffer</var>.[[ArrayBufferByteLength]].
Set <var data-type="byte sequence">data</var> to <var>arrayBuffer</var>.[[ArrayBufferData]].
Set the ndef's PAYLOAD LENGTH field to length.
If length > 0, set the ndef's PAYLOAD field to data.
If the type of a record's data is NDEFMessageInit,
Set the ndef's PAYLOAD field to the result of running the create NDEF message given record's data "external", and recordsDepth.
Set the ndef's PAYLOAD LENGTH field to the length of ndef's PAYLOAD field.
Return <var>ndef</var>.

algorithms.name: map local type to NDEF
algorithms.html:
To <dfn id="dfn-map-local-type-to-ndef" tabindex="0" aria-haspopup="dialog" data-dfn-type="dfn">map local type to NDEF</dfn> given <var data-type="NDEFRecordInit">record</var>,
        <var>ndef</var>, <var data-type="string">context</var>, and <var data-type="unsigned short">recordsDepth</var>,
        run these steps:

steps.html: If record's mediaType is not undefined, throw a TypeError.
If the type of a record's data is not BufferSource or NDEFMessageInit, throw a TypeError.
Set ndef's TNF field to 1 (well-known type record).
Let localTypeName be the record's recordType after the first occurrence of U+003A (:) up to the end of record's recordType.
Set ndef's TYPE field to localTypeName, representing the local type name.
If context is "smart-poster", localTypeName is "s" (0x73) and if the type of record's data is not BufferSource or its byte length is bigger than 4, throw a TypeError.

If context is "smart-poster", localTypeName is "act" (0x61 0x63 0x74) and if the type of record's data is not BufferSource or its byte length is not exactly one, throw a TypeError and abort these steps.
If the type of a record's data is BufferSource,
Set arrayBuffer to record's data.
Set <var data-type="unsigned long">length</var> to <var>arrayBuffer</var>.[[ArrayBufferByteLength]].
Set <var data-type="byte sequence">data</var> to <var>arrayBuffer</var>.[[ArrayBufferData]].
Set the ndef's PAYLOAD LENGTH field to length.
If length > 0, set the ndef's PAYLOAD field to data.
If the type of a record's data is NDEFMessageInit,
Set the ndef's PAYLOAD field to the result of running the create NDEF message given record's data "local", and recordsDepth.
Set the ndef's PAYLOAD LENGTH field to the length of ndef's PAYLOAD field.
Return <var>ndef</var>.

algorithms.name: map smart poster to NDEF
algorithms.html:
To <dfn id="dfn-map-smart-poster-to-ndef" tabindex="0" aria-haspopup="dialog" data-dfn-type="dfn">map smart poster to NDEF</dfn>, given <var data-type="NDEFRecordInit">record</var>,
        <var>ndef</var>, and <var data-type="unsigned short">recordsDepth</var>, run these steps:

steps.html: If record's mediaType is not undefined, throw a TypeError.
If the type of a record's data is not NDEFMessageInit, throw a TypeError.
Set ndef's TNF field to 1 (well-known type record).
Set ndef's TYPE field to "Sp" (0x53 0x70).
Set ndef's PAYLOAD field to the result of running the create NDEF message given record's data, "smart-poster", and recordsDepth.
Set ndef's PAYLOAD LENGTH field to the length of ndef's PAYLOAD field.
Return <var>ndef</var>.

algorithms.name: map absolute-URL to NDEF
algorithms.html:
To <dfn id="dfn-map-absolute-url-to-ndef" tabindex="0" aria-haspopup="dialog" data-dfn-type="dfn">map absolute-URL to NDEF</dfn> given <var data-type="NDEFRecordInit">record</var>,
        <var>ndef</var>, and <var data-type="string">context</var>, run these steps:

steps.html: If context is "smart-poster", throw a TypeError.
If record's mediaType is not undefined, throw a TypeError.
If record's data is not a DOMString, throw a TypeError.
If the result of parsing record's data is failure, throw a SyntaxError.
Set arrayBuffer to record's data.
Set <var data-type="byte sequence">data</var> to <var>arrayBuffer</var>.[[ArrayBufferData]].
Set ndef's TNF field to 3 (absolute-URL record).
Set ndef's TYPE field to data.
Set ndef's PAYLOAD LENGTH field to 0 and omit PAYLOAD field.
Return <var>ndef</var>.

algorithms.name: NDEFReader/makeReadOnly()
algorithms.html: The NDEFReader.makeReadOnly method, when invoked, MUST run the make an NFC tag permanently read-only algorithm:

steps.html: Let p be a new Promise object.
If not currently executing in the currently active top-level browsing context, then reject p with and "InvalidStateError" and return p.
Let <var data-type="NDEFMakeReadOnlyOptions">options</var> be the second argument.

Let <var data-type="AbortSignal">signal</var> be the <var data-type="NDEFMakeReadOnlyOptions">options</var>’ dictionary member
            of the same name if present, or null otherwise.
If signal is aborted, then reject p with signal's abort reason and return p.
If signal is not null, then add the following abort steps to signal:
Run the abort a pending make read-only operation on the environment settings object.
React to p:
If p was settled (fulfilled or rejected), then clear the pending write tuple if it exists.
Return p and run the following steps in parallel:
If the obtain permission steps return false, then reject p with a "NotAllowedError" and abort these steps.
If there is no underlying NFC Adapter, or if a connection cannot be established, then reject p with a "NotSupportedError" and abort these steps.
If the UA is not allowed to access the underlying NFC Adapter (e.g. a user preference), then reject p with a "NotReadableError" and abort these steps.
An implementation MAY reject p with a "NotSupportedError" and abort these steps.
Attempt to abort a pending make read-only operation.
Set pending makeReadOnly tuple to (this, p).
Run the start the NFC make read-only steps whenever an NFC tag device comes within communication range.

algorithms.name: start the NFC make read-only
algorithms.html: To <dfn id="dfn-start-the-nfc-make-read-only" tabindex="0" aria-haspopup="dialog" data-dfn-type="dfn">start the NFC make read-only</dfn>, run these steps:

steps.html: Let p be the pending makeReadOnly tuple's promise.
If the NFC tag in proximity range does not expose NDEF technology for formatting, then reject p with a "NotSupportedError" and return p.
Verify that NFC is not suspended.
In case of success, run the following steps:
Make device permanently read-only, using the NFC adapter in communication range with device.
When the operation has completed, resolve <var data-type="Promise">p</var>.

algorithms.name: clean up the pending scan
algorithms.html: When the NDEFReader.scan method is invoked, the UA MUST run the following NFC listen algorithm:

steps.html: Let p be a new Promise object.
If not currently executing in the currently active top-level browsing context, then reject p with an "InvalidStateError" and return p.
Let reader be the NDEFReader instance.
Let <var>options</var> be first argument.

Let <var data-type="AbortSignal">signal</var> be the <var>options</var>’ dictionary member
            of the same name if present, or null otherwise.
If signal is aborted, then reject p with signal's abort reason and return p.
If signal is not null, then add the following clean up the pending scan steps to signal:
Remove reader from the activated reader objects.
If the activated reader objects is empty, then make a request to stop listening to NDEF messages on all NFC adapters.
Return p and run the following steps in parallel:
If the obtain permission steps return false, then reject p with a "NotAllowedError" and abort these steps.
If there is no underlying NFC Adapter, or if a connection cannot be established, then reject p with a "NotSupportedError" and abort these steps.
If the UA is not allowed to access the underlying NFC Adapter (e.g. a user preference), then reject p with a "NotReadableError" and abort these steps.
If reader is already in the activated reader objects, then reject p with an "InvalidStateError" and abort these steps.
Add reader to the activated reader objects.
Resolve <var data-type="Promise">p</var>.
Whenever the UA detects NFC technology, run the NFC reading algorithm.
If NFC is suspended, abort these steps.
If the NFC tag in proximity range does not expose NDEF technology for reading or formatting, run the following sub-steps:
For each NDEFReader instance reader in the activated reader objects, run the following sub-steps:
Fire an event named "readingerror" at reader.
Abort these steps.

Let <var data-type="serialNumber">serialNumber</var> be the device identifier as a series of
        numbers, or null if unavailable.
If serialNumber is not null, set it to the string of U+003A (:) concatenating each number represented as ASCII hex digit, in the same order.
Let message be a new NDEFMessage object, with message's records set to the empty list.
If the NFC tag in proximity range is unformatted and is NDEF-formattable, let input be null. Otherwise, let input be the notation for the NDEF message which has been received.
For each NDEF record which is part of input, run the following sub-steps:
Let ndef be the notation for the current NDEF record with typeNameField corresponding to the TNF field and payload corresponding to the PAYLOAD field data.
Let record be the result of parse an NDEF record given ndef and "".
If record is not null, append record to message's records.
Run the dispatch NFC content steps with given serialNumber and message.

algorithms.name: dispatch NFC content
algorithms.html: To dispatch NFC content given a serialNumber of type serialNumber and a message of type NDEFMessage, run these steps:

steps.html: For each NDEFReader instance reader in the activated reader objects,
fire an event named "reading" at reader using NDEFReadingEvent with its serialNumber attribute initialized to serialNumber and its message attribute initialized to message.
If the length of bytes is 0, return null.
Let <var>records</var> be the empty list.

As long as there are unread bytes of <var data-type="byte sequence">bytes</var>, run the following
        sub-steps:
If the remaining length of bytes is less than 3, return null.

If any of the following steps requires reading bytes beyond the
            remaining length of <var data-type="byte sequence">bytes</var>, return null.
Let ndef be the notation for the current NDEF record.
Let <var data-type="byte">header</var> be the next byte of <var data-type="byte sequence">bytes</var>.
Let messageBegin (MB field) be the left most bit (bit 7) of header.

If this is the first iteration of these sub-steps and
                <var data-type="boolean">messageBegin</var> is false, return null.
Let messageEnd (ME field) be bit 6 of header.
Let shortRecord (SR field) be bit 4 of header.
Let hasIdLength (IL field) be bit 3 of header.
Let ndef's typeNameField (TNF field) be the integer value of bit 2-0 of header.
Let typeLength be the integer value of next byte (TYPE LENGTH field) of bytes.
If shortRecord is true, let payloadLength be the integer value of next byte (PAYLOAD LENGTH field) of bytes.

Otherwise, let <var data-type="number">payloadLength</var> be the integer value of the next 4
            bytes of <var data-type="byte sequence">bytes</var>.
If hasIdLength is true, let idLength be the integer value of next byte (ID LENGTH field) of bytes, otherwise let it be 0.
If typeLength > 0, let ndef's type be result of running UTF-8 decode on the next typeLength (TYPE field) bytes, or else let type be the empty string.
If idLength > 0, let ndef's id be result of running UTF-8 decode on the next idLength (ID field) bytes, or else let ndef's id be the empty string.
Let ndef's payload be the byte sequence of the last payloadLength (PAYLOAD field) bytes, which may be 0 bytes.
Let record be the result of parse an NDEF record given ndef and context.
If record is not null, append record to records.
If <var data-type="boolean">messageEnd</var> is true,
If check parsed records given records and context throws an error, reject promise with error and abort these steps.
Otherwise abort these sub-steps (terminate the loop).
Return <var>records</var>.
If context is "smart-poster" and records does not contain exactly one URI record, or if it contains more than one type record, size record or action record, throw a TypeError.
Otherwise return true.

algorithms.name: parse an NDEF record
algorithms.html:
To <dfn id="dfn-parse-an-ndef-record" tabindex="0" aria-haspopup="dialog" data-dfn-type="dfn">parse an NDEF record</dfn> given <var>ndef</var> and <var data-type="string">context</var> into a
    <var data-type="NDEFRecord">record</var>, run these steps:

steps.html: Set record's id to ndef's id.
Set record's lang to null.
Set record's encoding to null.
If ndef's typeNameField (TNF field) is 0 (empty record):
Set record's id to null.
Set record's recordType to "empty".
Set record's mediaType to null.
Set record's data to null.
If ndef's typeNameField is 1 (well-known type record), then
If ndef's type is "T" (0x54), set record to the result of running parse an NDEF text record on ndef.
If ndef's type is "U" (0x55), set record to the result of running parse an NDEF URL record on ndef.
If ndef's type is "Sp" (0x53 0x70), set record to the result of running parse an NDEF smart-poster record on ndef.
If ndef's type is "s" (0x73) and if context is equal to "smart-poster", set record to the result of running parse a smart-poster size record on ndef.
If ndef's type is "t" (0x74) and if context is equal to "smart-poster", set record to the result of running parse a smart-poster type record on ndef.
If ndef's type is "act" (0x61 0x63 0x74) and if context is equal to "smart-poster", set record to the result of running parse a smart-poster action record on ndef.
If running the validate local type steps on ndef's type returns true,
If context is not "external" or "smart-poster", throw a TypeError.
Set record to the result of running parse a local type record on ndef.
Otherwise throw a TypeError.

If ndef's typeNameField is 2 (MIME type record), then set record to the result of running parse an NDEF MIME type record on ndef, or make sure that the underlying platform provides equivalent values to the record object's properties.
If ndef's typeNameField is 3 (absolute-URL record), then set record to the result of running parse an NDEF absolute-URL record on ndef.

If ndef's typeNameField is 4 (external type record), then set record to the result of running parse an NDEF external type record on ndef, or make sure that the underlying platform provides equivalent values to the record object's properties.

If ndef's typeNameField is 5 (unknown record) then set record to the result of running parse an NDEF unknown record on ndef, or make sure that the underlying platform provides equivalent values to the record object's properties.
Otherwise throw a TypeError.

algorithms.name: parse an NDEF text record
algorithms.html:
To <dfn id="dfn-parse-an-ndef-text-record" tabindex="0" aria-haspopup="dialog" data-dfn-type="dfn">parse an NDEF text record</dfn> given an <var>ndefRecord</var> into a
    <var data-type="NDEFRecord">record</var>, run these steps:

steps.html: Set record's recordType to "text".
Set record's mediaType to null.
If ndefRecord's PAYLOAD field is not present, set record's data to null and return record.
Let header be the first byte of ndefRecord's PAYLOAD field.
Let languageLength be the value given by bit 5 to bit 0 of the header.
Let language be the result of running ASCII decode on second byte to the languageLength + 1 byte, inclusive.
Let buffer be the byte sequence of the rest of the ndefRecords's PAYLOAD field (excluding header and languageLength number of bytes).
Set record's lang to language.
Set record's encoding be "utf-8" if bit 7 (MB field) of header is equal to the value 0, or else "utf-16be".
Set record's data to buffer.
Return <var data-type="NDEFRecord">record</var>.

algorithms.name: parse an NDEF URL record
algorithms.html:
To <dfn id="dfn-parse-an-ndef-url-record" tabindex="0" aria-haspopup="dialog" data-dfn-type="dfn">parse an NDEF URL record</dfn> given an <var>ndefRecord</var> into a
    <var data-type="NDEFRecord">record</var>, run these steps:

steps.html: Set record's recordType to "url".
Set record's mediaType to null.
If ndefRecord's PAYLOAD field is not present, set record's data to null and return record.
Let buffer be the byte sequence of ndefRecords's PAYLOAD field.
Let prefixByte be the value of the first byte of buffer.
If the value of prefixByte matches the URL expansion codes in the NFC Forum Technical Specifications URI Record Type Definition specification, Section 3.2.2, Table 3, then
Let prefixString be the byte sequence value corresponding to the value of prefixByte.
Set record's data to prefixString appended to buffer.
Otherwise, if there is no match for prefixByte, set record's data to buffer.
Return <var data-type="NDEFRecord">record</var>.

algorithms.name: parse an NDEF smart-poster record
algorithms.html:
To <dfn id="dfn-parse-an-ndef-smart-poster-record" tabindex="0" aria-haspopup="dialog" data-dfn-type="dfn">parse an NDEF smart-poster record</dfn> given an <var>ndefRecord</var> into a
    <var data-type="NDEFRecord">record</var>, run these steps:

steps.html: Set record's recordType to "smart-poster".
Set record's mediaType to null.
If ndefRecord's PAYLOAD field is not present, set record's data to null and return record.
Let buffer be the byte sequence of ndefRecords's PAYLOAD field.
Set record's data to buffer.
Return <var data-type="NDEFRecord">record</var>.

algorithms.name: parse a smart-poster size record
algorithms.html:
To <dfn id="dfn-parse-a-smart-poster-size-record" tabindex="0" aria-haspopup="dialog" data-dfn-type="dfn">parse a smart-poster size record</dfn> given an <var>ndefRecord</var> into a
    <var data-type="NDEFRecord">record</var>, run these steps:

steps.html: Set record's recordType to ":s".
Set record's mediaType to null.
If ndefRecord's PAYLOAD field has not exactly 4 bytes, throw a TypeError.
Let buffer be the byte sequence of ndefRecords's PAYLOAD field.
Set record's data to buffer.
Return <var data-type="NDEFRecord">record</var>.

algorithms.name: parse a smart-poster type record
algorithms.html:
To <dfn id="dfn-parse-a-smart-poster-type-record" tabindex="0" aria-haspopup="dialog" data-dfn-type="dfn">parse a smart-poster type record</dfn> given an <var>ndefRecord</var> into a
    <var data-type="NDEFRecord">record</var>, run these steps:

steps.html: Set record's recordType to ":t".
Set record's mediaType to null.
Let buffer be the byte sequence of ndefRecords's PAYLOAD field.
Set record's data to buffer.
Return <var data-type="NDEFRecord">record</var>.

algorithms.name: parse a smart-poster action record
algorithms.html:
To <dfn id="dfn-parse-a-smart-poster-action-record" tabindex="0" aria-haspopup="dialog" data-dfn-type="dfn">parse a smart-poster action record</dfn> given an <var>ndefRecord</var> into
    a <var data-type="NDEFRecord">record</var>, run these steps:

steps.html: Set record's recordType to ":act".
Set record's mediaType to null.
If ndefRecord's PAYLOAD field has not exactly 1 byte, throw a TypeError.
Let buffer be the byte sequence of ndefRecords's PAYLOAD field.
Set record's data to buffer.
Return <var data-type="NDEFRecord">record</var>.

algorithms.name: parse a local type record
algorithms.html:
To <dfn id="dfn-parse-a-local-type-record" tabindex="0" aria-haspopup="dialog" data-dfn-type="dfn">parse a local type record</dfn> given <var>ndef</var> into
    a <var data-type="NDEFRecord">record</var>, run these steps:

steps.html: Set record's recordType to ":" (U+003A) concatenated with ndef's type.
Set record's mediaType to null.
Let buffer be the byte sequence of ndefRecords's PAYLOAD field.
Set record's data to buffer.
Return <var data-type="NDEFRecord">record</var>.

algorithms.name: parse an NDEF MIME type record
algorithms.html:
To <dfn id="dfn-parse-an-ndef-mime-type-record" tabindex="0" aria-haspopup="dialog" data-dfn-type="dfn">parse an NDEF MIME type record</dfn> given an <var>ndefRecord</var> into a
      <var data-type="NDEFRecord">record</var>, run these steps:

steps.html: Set record's recordType to "mime".
Set record's mediaType to the result of serialize a MIME type with mimeType as the input.
Let buffer be the byte sequence of ndefRecords's PAYLOAD field if that exists, or otherwise null.
Set record's data to buffer.
Return <var data-type="NDEFRecord">record</var>.

algorithms.name: parse an NDEF absolute-URL record
algorithms.html:
To <dfn id="dfn-parse-an-ndef-absolute-url-record" tabindex="0" aria-haspopup="dialog" data-dfn-type="dfn">parse an NDEF absolute-URL record</dfn> given an <var>ndefRecord</var> into
      a <var data-type="NDEFRecord">record</var>, run these steps:

steps.html: Set record's recordType to "absolute-url".
Set record's mediaType to null.
Let buffer be the byte sequence of ndefRecords's TYPE field.
Set record's data to buffer.
Return <var data-type="NDEFRecord">record</var>.

algorithms.name: parse an NDEF external type record
algorithms.html:
To <dfn id="dfn-parse-an-ndef-external-type-record" tabindex="0" aria-haspopup="dialog" data-dfn-type="dfn">parse an NDEF external type record</dfn> given an <var>ndefRecord</var> into
      a <var data-type="NDEFRecord">record</var>, run these steps:

steps.html: If running validate external type on record's ndefRecord's TYPE field returns false, return null.
Let domain and type be the result of running split external type with the value of ndefRecord's TYPE field.

Let domain be the result of running Unicode ToUnicode with domain_name set to domain, CheckHyphens set to false, CheckBidi set to true, CheckJoiners set to true, UseSTD3ASCIIRules set to true, and Transitional_Processing set to false. If result contains any errors, return null.
Set record's recordType to domain, ":" and type concatenated.
Set record's mediaType to null.
Let buffer be the byte sequence of ndefRecords's PAYLOAD field if that exists, or otherwise null.
Set record's data to buffer.
Return <var data-type="NDEFRecord">record</var>.

algorithms.name: parse an NDEF unknown record
algorithms.html:
To <dfn id="dfn-parse-an-ndef-unknown-record" tabindex="0" aria-haspopup="dialog" data-dfn-type="dfn">parse an NDEF unknown record</dfn> given an <var>ndefRecord</var> into a
      <var data-type="NDEFRecord">record</var>, run these steps:

steps.html: Set record's recordType to "unknown".
Set record's mediaType to null.
Let buffer be the byte sequence of ndefRecords's PAYLOAD field if that exists, or otherwise null.
Set record's data to buffer.
Return <var data-type="NDEFRecord">record</var>.

algorithms.name: parsing the blocklist
algorithms.html:
The result of <dfn id="dfn-parsing-the-blocklist" tabindex="0" aria-haspopup="dialog" data-dfn-type="dfn">parsing the blocklist</dfn> at a <var data-type="URL">url</var> is a list of
    historical bytes hexadecimal values, produced by the following algorithm:

steps.html: Fetch <var data-type="URL">url</var>, and let <var data-type="string">contents</var> be its body, decoded as UTF-8.
Let lines be contents split on "\n".
Let result be an empty list.
For each line in lines, run the following sub-steps:
If <var data-type="string">line</var> is empty, continue to the next line.
If line starts with "#", continue to the next line.
If <var data-type="string">line</var> contains invalid hexadecimal values, continue to the next line.
Append line to result.
Return <var data-type="list">result</var>.
